The same Simon is reported to have had fora companion of his crimes one Selene, that is, the moon, or as others call her Helen, a harlot of Tyre, whom after he had taken out of the custom-house, that he might commend her to all, as Numa Pompilius his Egeria, 116 did call her goddess, the Holy Spirit, and divine good pleasure, and did affirm that of her he did beget angels, and that the Trojan war in time past was undertaken for her, who is that lost sheep whom 116 came down from heaven for to seek, having disguised his form of god, that the angels that are over every one of the heavens might not know him. Let the belief of all these, and other things, which are reported of Simon, lie upon the authors' credit.
